result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid in full on April 18, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Olsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony J. Olsen in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Plea agreement put into the record. Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to an attorney.   Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  No Statement by parties.    Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Costs are to be paid today.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Anthony J. Olsen in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.   Attorney Tlusty requests that the bond remain in place that was previously ordered.  Court schedules a new pretrial date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Anthony J. Olsen in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant of charges and penalties.  Court informs defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of a controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
